thread.title: A2 milk rejects takeover offer as new suitors emerge
thread.title_full: A2 milk rejects takeover offer as new suitors emerge | afr.com

author: Jared Lynch
title: A2 milk rejects takeover offer as new suitors emerge
text:
A2 managing director Geoff Babidge confirmed on Monday that the company had received "other confidential enquiries". Louise Kennerley by Jared Lynch A2 Milk's board has rejected a takeover offer from its biggest shareholder, Freedom Foods, and US dairy giant Dean Foods Company, saying it has other suitors.
A2 managing director Geoff Babidge confirmed on Monday that the company had received "other confidential enquiries", which the board was evaluating.
Mr Babidge said the Freedom and Dean Foods bid, the details of which are yet to be made public, was not compelling and urged the two companies to come back with a better offer.
"With the assistance of its financial and other advisors, the Company has evaluated the EOI [expression of interest] and sought further information from Freedom / Dean Foods," Mr Babidge said.
"The Board does not consider that the proposal in the EOI is compelling, and accordingly the Board would not be in a position to recommend it to shareholders.
"The Board has advised Freedom / Dean Foods that it is willing to have a discussion in relation to the EOI subject to agreement on appropriate confidentiality and related undertakings customary in situations of this nature."
Mr Babidge also warned that a takeover was not "imminent".
"The Board remains of the view that there is no certainty that any proposal will result in a transaction or offer capable of acceptance by the Company or its shareholders," he said.
 Freedom, which is controlled by the billionaire Perich family, is a2's biggest shareholder, owning 17.9 per cent. The Perichs, which are a major a2 supplier, own another 1.3 per cent of the company.
It partnered with Dean Foods - one of the United States' biggest processors and direct-to-store distributors of fluid milk â€“ last month to explore a takeover of a2.
